question: Which of the following river is not in existence at present?
explanation: Saraswati River was a distributary of the Bhagirathi and its existence is no more there. It was active till around the 16th century AD. The course and condition of the Saraswati had played a significant role in the development and decline of river port towns in Bengal. Initially, the major port town was located at Tamralipta. And after the decline of the town, Saptagram rose and declined, and eventually Kolkata came up.
